@King_Lingerz wrote:

No. For example:

public class Test {

public int tradeTimer = 5;

It can’t be in a case or a method or anything. It belongs OUTSIDE them.

item.title: Can someone give me the code to stop duping on my server?!?
item.dc:creator: @bloodmaniet bloodmaniet
item.description:
@bloodmaniet wrote:

[quote=“King Lingerz, post:13, topic:289930”][quote author=_™ link=topic=383258.msg2879186#msg2879186 date=1248221240]
amg liek if (tiemr == 0) { //den all ur traed st00f }
[/quote]

Expanding on that slightly…

public int tradeTimer = 5;

if (tradeTimer == 0) {
	//Trade stuff ect.
} else {
	sendMessage("You must wait " + tradeTimer + " seconds before logging out.");
}

That’s just a little bit to get you started. (An expansion of _™’s post)

Should be pretty easy for you to do the rest. ;)[/quote]

Ok i’ve added that but one problem i have 1 error in clicking most. and i want u to see it

clickingMost.java:1992: illegal start of expression
public int tradeTimer = 5;
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .

now idk wht its talking about like if i need to add a } or a { above the p or what…

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone give me the code to stop duping on my server?!?

item.title: Can someone give me the code to stop duping on my server?!?
item.dc:creator: @beta beta_
item.description:
@beta wrote:

[quote=“King Lingerz, post:13, topic:289930”][quote author=_™ link=topic=383258.msg2879186#msg2879186 date=1248221240]
amg liek if (tiemr == 0) { //den all ur traed st00f }
[/quote]

Expanding on that slightly…

public int tradeTimer = 5;

if (tradeTimer == 0) {
	//Trade stuff ect.
} else {
	sendMessage("You must wait " + tradeTimer + " seconds before logging out.");
}

That’s just a little bit to get you started. (An expansion of _™’s post)

Should be pretty easy for you to do the rest. ;)[/quote]
You shouldn’t use variables for timers, it’s not a great way to do it.
Instead you could create something along the lines of a timer class.
An example of this is as follows.

/**
 * A timer.
 * @author beta_
 */
public class Timer {

	/**
	 * The start time.
	 */
    private long time = System.currentTimeMillis();
    
    /**
     * Reset the timer.
     */
    public void reset() {
        time = System.currentTimeMillis();
    }
    
    /**
     * Get the elapsed time.
     * @return milliseconds elapsed.
     */
    public long elapsed() {
        return System.currentTimeMillis() - time;
    }

}

Then to use it you would use.

private Timer tradeTimer = new Timer(); // Create a new Timer instance.
if(tradeTimer.elapsed() >= 60000) { // Execute the following code if 60000 milliseconds or 1 minute has passed.
    tradeTimer.reset();
    // Trade crap
} else { // Otherwise...
   sendMessage("You must wait " + (60000 - tradeTimer.elapsed()) + " milliseconds before logging out."); // Send the message
}

Although a better way to do it would be a properly programmed trading system.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bloodmaniet bloodmaniet
item.description:
@bloodmaniet wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:10, topic:289930”][quote author=silabgarza link=topic=383258.msg2879227#msg2879227 date=1248223480]
this is how u fix every dupe on every source

step 1)
search for this

outStream.writeString("Trade with");

u shuld see

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(4); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("Trade with"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

now delete it!
save, compile, restart
DONE
[/quote]

You are a big dumb idiot.[/quote]

LMAO!!! ME OR HER? and anyway is that the real way?
